mil.emp3.api.interfaces

Interface IFeature<T extends IGeoRenderable>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IContainer, IGeoAltitudeMode, IGeoBase, IGeoContainer, IGeoPositionGroup, IGeoRenderable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IGeoJSON, IKML
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AirControlMeasure, Circle, Ellipse, Feature, GeoJSON, KML, MilStdSymbol, Path, Point, Polygon, Rectangle, Square, Text

    public interface IFeature<T extends IGeoRenderable>
extends IContainer, IGeoRenderable
    This interface is the base for all features. All single point and multi point shapes and symbols that are displayed on the Map use Feature as their base class. Feature class provides for graphical properties, hierarchy placement and geo spatial positions among other attributes. Feature is a Container and as such it can contain other Features. A Feature can be a child of many other containers and it can have many children. Visibility of a feature is governed by its own visibility and visibility of its parents.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.cmapi.primitives.IGeoAltitudeMode

      • apply

        void apply(java.lang.Object userContext)
        This method triggers an update of the feature. After changing any feature properties, this method MUST be called to force an update to be sent to the map(s).
        Parameters:
        userContext - user defined object

      • apply

        void apply()
        This method triggers an update of the feature. After changing any feature properties, this method MUST be called to force an update to be sent to the map(s).

      • validate

        void validate()
        This method validates the feature. It throws an unchecked exception if validation fails.
